page.title: 12Cuerden Valley Park
page.content: This is a linear{Country Park} developed by Central Lancashire New Town and was opened in 1980. It follows the valley of the river Lostock. The park runs from the A6 at Whittle-le-Woods in the south, across the B5256 at Town Brow, Clayton-le- Woods, where there is a car park and {access for wheelchairs}and finishes near the junction of the A49 and A6 at Bamber Bridge. Most of the park is active{farmland} used for raising sheep and cattle, with well signed paths for visitors. About 85,000 shrubs and trees, mostly of native species have been planted to extend the wooded areas. It provides very pleasant walking, with several{picnic sites,}within a densly populated urban area. There are{car parking}areas at Town Brow and Whittle-le-Woods.
